attributes.name: Seagrass
attributes.description:
The Global Distribution of Seagrasses data set was compiled by the United Nations Environment World Conservation Monitoring Centre (UNEP-WCMC). The data set is comprised of global seagrass occurences, captured in point locations and polygons, which were measured from 1934 to 2015. These data contain information on the seagrass family, genus, and species, as well as which country the seagrass resides in and whether or not it is in a protected area.   
  
This data set was created from multiple sources over 128 countries and territories. These sources include maps (of varying scales), expert interpolation and point-based samples. Before inclusion in the dataset, occurrence records were reviewed using published reports, peer-reviewed literature and expert consultation. Resource Watch shows only a subset of the data set. For access to the full data set and additional information, see the Learn More link.  
  
### Additional Information  
  
Resource Watch shows only a subset of the dataset. For access to the full dataset and additional information, click on the “Learn more” button.  
  
### Disclaimer  
  
Excerpts of this description page were taken from the source metadata.

info.name: Seagrass

sources.source-description: United Nations Environment World Conservation Monitoring Centre (UNEP-WCMC)

info.cautions: Validation (of version 1) was also undertaken through a global seagrass workshop comprising experts from 23 countries. As the dataset contains overlapping polygons, a dissolve operation (by ISO3) in GIS is required before surface area calculations are carried out. Based on recent genetic and morphometric analysis, Halophilla johnsonii, Halophila hawaiiana, Halophila ovata and Halophila minor are now considered to be morphological variations of, and therefore conspecific with, Halophila ovalis. Zostera mucronata, Zostera muelleri and Zostera novazelandica are now considered to be morphological variations of, and therefore conspecific with, Zostera capricorni. Note that the older components of the dataset (particularly in version 1) are likely to have been fitted to the best shoreline data available at the time, i.e. ESRI's "Digital Chart of the World" and “MundoCart digital database(both derived from Operational Navigation Charts). As a result, there may be placement errors when mapped onto recent shoreline datasets (e.g. GSHHD, Open Street Map), e.g. Belize.
info.citation: UNEP-WCMC, Short FT (2018). Global distribution of seagrasses (version 6.0). Sixth update to the data layer used in Green and Short (2003). Cambridge (UK): UN Environment World Conservation Monitoring Centre. URL: http://data.unep-wcmc.org/datasets/7. Accessed through Resource Watch, (date). [www.resourcewatch.org](https://www.resourcewatch.org).

name.description: Name of feature, as given by the data provider.

protect.description: '0' = not within a protected area, '1' = partially within a protected area, and '2' = fully within a protected area
